facts: Social media platforms use algorithms, which are sets of rules, to decide which posts you see first.
A hashtag groups posts about the same topic so people can search and join a bigger conversation.
Many social media companies make money mainly from ads that are targeted using information like your interests and activity.
A post that spreads very quickly from person to person is called “viral,” similar to how a virus can spread fast.
What you share online can leave a digital footprint, meaning it can be saved, copied, or found later even if you delete it.
Scammers and fake accounts may pretend to be real people, so checking sources and not sharing personal details is important.
Spending too much time on social media can affect sleep and mood for some people, so taking breaks can be healthy.
